Events that occurred on 24 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - Edith Tolkien writes her first letter to her husband in Brooklands Officers' from Cheltenham.
1951 - Author Orson Scott Card is born.
1957 - Actor Stephen Fry is born.
1965 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 275a.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien lends Rayner Unwin a reading-copy of "The End of Bovadium".
1973 - Actress Grey DeLisle is born.
1974 - Mythcon 5 at Scripps College in Claremont, California.
1992 - Tolkien Centenary Conference, a combination of Oxonmoot and Mythcon.
1998 - CarolinaCon Regional MECCG Newsletter issue 2 is published.
2006 - The Oxford Tolkien Conference at Exeter College, Oxford.
2007 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar, "The City of Kings" is released in Europe.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
